Who: RODIMUS
Location: Black Fortress - Prison cell control room

> Tucson =
Prime knew he had his work cut out for him. It wouldn't be easy attempting =
to turn Rodimus around. He simply sighs, and does not give anyone the satis=
faction of losing his temper. The less he expressed his disdain, the more h=
e hoped to cause a bit of frustration among his captives. He had an old say=
ing. "Don't get mad, use your strongest of attributes and talents to passiv=
ely retaliate against your enemies.
>
> "Ohh well, I may be in trouble for =
a while, and it wouldn't be the first time."

Rodimus stepped into the cont=
rol room as Tuscon was making his
comment. While the others in the cells co=
uld not hear each other,
Rodimus could each one of them if he chose to.

He=
 glanced at the security screen to watch Tuscon, laying there
practically i=
mmobile by the restraints, and yet he was still trying to
speak. Part of Ro=
dimus was disdainful of the Autobot, but then again
there was something abo=
ut his courage and conviction that touched him
strangely.

Fighting that em=
otion Rodimus jabbed on the control stud that would
send his voice down to =
Tuscon, into the speaker by his ear. "What have
you to say for yourself now=
 Autobot?" Rodimus said as he watched him.
"You have lost, why don't you ju=
st give up?"

(TAG)

Preston
